SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nimport { IERC721 } from '../../../interfaces/IERC721.sol';\nimport { IERC721Base } from './IERC721Base.sol';\nimport { ERC721BaseInternal } from './ERC721BaseInternal.sol';\n\n/**\n * @title Base ERC721 implementation, excluding optional extensions\n * @dev inheritor must either implement ERC165 supportsInterface or inherit ERC165Base\n */\nabstract contract ERC721Base is IERC721Base, ERC721BaseInternal {\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function balanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256) {\n        return _balanceOf(account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function ownerOf(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (address) {\n        return _ownerOf(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function getApproved(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (address) {\n        return _getApproved(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function isApprovedForAll(\n        address account,\n        address operator\n    ) external view returns (bool) {\n        return _isApprovedForAll(account, operator);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function transferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) external payable {\n        _transferFrom(from, to, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function safeTransferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) external payable {\n        _safeTransferFrom(from, to, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function safeTransferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) external payable {\n        _safeTransferFrom(from, to, tokenId, data);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function approve(address operator, uint256 tokenId) external payable {\n        _approve(operator, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC721\n     */\n    function setApprovalForAll(address operator, bool status) external {\n        _setApprovalForAll(operator, status);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xfedcffd8d3aaf06e7c2f42ce7b8756c8b62442b0cb731c15b53f5d237104863a","license":"MIT"},"@solidstate/contracts/token/ERC721/base/ERC721BaseInternal.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nimport { IERC721Receiver } from '../../../interfaces/IERC721Receiver.sol';\nimport { EnumerableMap } from '../../../data/EnumerableMap.sol';\nimport { EnumerableSet } from '../../../data/EnumerableSet.sol';\nimport { AddressUtils } from '../../../utils/AddressUtils.sol';\nimport { IERC721BaseInternal } from './IERC721BaseInternal.sol';\nimport { ERC721BaseStorage } from './ERC721BaseStorage.sol';\n\n/**\n * @title Base ERC721 internal functions\n */\nabstract contract ERC721BaseInternal is IERC721BaseInternal {\n    using AddressUtils for address;\n    using EnumerableMap for EnumerableMap.UintToAddressMap;\n    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.UintSet;\n\n    function _balanceOf(\n        address account\n    ) internal view virtual returns (uint256) {\n        if (account == address(0)) revert ERC721Base__BalanceQueryZeroAddress();\n        return ERC721BaseStorage.layout().holderTokens[account].length();\n    }\n\n    function _ownerOf(uint256 tokenId) internal view virtual returns (address) {\n        address owner = ERC721BaseStorage.layout().tokenOwners.get(tokenId);\n        if (owner == address(0)) revert ERC721Base__InvalidOwner();\n        return owner;\n    }\n\n    function _exists(uint256 tokenId) internal view virtual returns (bool) {\n        return ERC721BaseStorage.layout().tokenOwners.contains(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _getApproved(\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal view virtual returns (address) {\n        if (!_exists(tokenId)) revert ERC721Base__NonExistentToken();\n\n        return ERC721BaseStorage.layout().tokenApprovals[tokenId];\n    }\n\n    function _isApprovedForAll(\n        address account,\n        address operator\n    ) internal view virtual returns (bool) {\n        return ERC721BaseStorage.layout().operatorApprovals[account][operator];\n    }\n\n    function _isApprovedOrOwner(\n        address spender,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal view virtual returns (bool) {\n        if (!_exists(tokenId)) revert ERC721Base__NonExistentToken();\n\n        address owner = _ownerOf(tokenId);\n\n        return (spender == owner ||\n            _getApproved(tokenId) == spender ||\n            _isApprovedForAll(owner, spender));\n    }\n\n    function _mint(address to, uint256 tokenId) internal virtual {\n        if (to == address(0)) revert ERC721Base__MintToZeroAddress();\n        if (_exists(tokenId)) revert ERC721Base__TokenAlreadyMinted();\n\n        _beforeTokenTransfer(address(0), to, tokenId);\n\n        ERC721BaseStorage.Layout storage l = ERC721BaseStorage.layout();\n\n        l.holderTokens[to].add(tokenId);\n        l.tokenOwners.set(tokenId, to);\n\n        emit Transfer(address(0), to, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _safeMint(address to, uint256 tokenId) internal virtual {\n        _safeMint(to, tokenId, '');\n    }\n\n    function _safeMint(\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) internal virtual {\n        _mint(to, tokenId);\n        if (!_checkOnERC721Received(address(0), to, tokenId, data))\n            revert ERC721Base__ERC721ReceiverNotImplemented();\n    }\n\n    function _burn(uint256 tokenId) internal virtual {\n        address owner = _ownerOf(tokenId);\n\n        _beforeTokenTransfer(owner, address(0), tokenId);\n\n        ERC721BaseStorage.Layout storage l = ERC721BaseStorage.layout();\n\n        l.holderTokens[owner].remove(tokenId);\n        l.tokenOwners.remove(tokenId);\n\n        l.tokenApprovals[tokenId] = address(0);\n\n        emit Approval(owner, address(0), tokenId);\n        emit Transfer(owner, address(0), tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _transfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal virtual {\n        address owner = _ownerOf(tokenId);\n\n        if (owner != from) revert ERC721Base__NotTokenOwner();\n        if (to == address(0)) revert ERC721Base__TransferToZeroAddress();\n\n        _beforeTokenTransfer(from, to, tokenId);\n\n        ERC721BaseStorage.Layout storage l = ERC721BaseStorage.layout();\n\n        l.holderTokens[from].remove(tokenId);\n        l.holderTokens[to].add(tokenId);\n        l.tokenOwners.set(tokenId, to);\n        l.tokenApprovals[tokenId] = address(0);\n\n        emit Approval(owner, address(0), tokenId);\n        emit Transfer(from, to, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _transferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal virtual {\n        _handleTransferMessageValue(from, to, tokenId, msg.value);\n        if (!_isApprovedOrOwner(msg.sender, tokenId))\n            revert ERC721Base__NotOwnerOrApproved();\n        _transfer(from, to, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _safeTransfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) internal virtual {\n        _transfer(from, to, tokenId);\n        if (!_checkOnERC721Received(from, to, tokenId, data))\n            revert ERC721Base__ERC721ReceiverNotImplemented();\n    }\n\n    function _safeTransferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal virtual {\n        _safeTransferFrom(from, to, tokenId, '');\n    }\n\n    function _safeTransferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) internal virtual {\n        _handleTransferMessageValue(from, to, tokenId, msg.value);\n        if (!_isApprovedOrOwner(msg.sender, tokenId))\n            revert ERC721Base__NotOwnerOrApproved();\n        _safeTransfer(from, to, tokenId, data);\n    }\n\n    function _approve(address operator, uint256 tokenId) internal virtual {\n        _handleApproveMessageValue(operator, tokenId, msg.value);\n\n        address owner = _ownerOf(tokenId);\n\n        if (operator == owner) revert ERC721Base__SelfApproval();\n        if (msg.sender != owner && !_isApprovedForAll(owner, msg.sender))\n            revert ERC721Base__NotOwnerOrApproved();\n\n        ERC721BaseStorage.layout().tokenApprovals[tokenId] = operator;\n        emit Approval(owner, operator, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _setApprovalForAll(\n        address operator,\n        bool status\n    ) internal virtual {\n        if (operator == msg.sender) revert ERC721Base__SelfApproval();\n        ERC721BaseStorage.layout().operatorApprovals[msg.sender][\n            operator\n        ] = status;\n        emit ApprovalForAll(msg.sender, operator, status);\n    }\n\n    function _checkOnERC721Received(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) internal virtual returns (bool) {\n        if (!to.isContract()) {\n            return true;\n        }\n\n        bytes memory returnData = to.functionCall(\n            abi.encodeWithSelector(\n                IERC721Receiver(to).onERC721Received.selector,\n                msg.sender,\n                from,\n                tokenId,\n                data\n            ),\n            'ERC721: transfer to non ERC721Receiver implementer'\n        );\n\n        bytes4 returnValue = abi.decode(returnData, (bytes4));\n        return returnValue == type(IERC721Receiver).interfaceId;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice ERC721 hook, called before externally called approvals for processing of included message value\n     * @param operator beneficiary of approval\n     * @param tokenId id of transferred token\n     * @param value message value\n     */\n    function _handleApproveMessageValue(\n        address operator,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 value\n    ) internal virtual {}\n\n    /**\n     * @notice ERC721 hook, called before externally called transfers for processing of included message value\n     * @param from sender of token\n     * @param to receiver of token\n     * @param tokenId id of transferred token\n     * @param value message value\n     */\n    function _handleTransferMessageValue(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 value\n    ) internal virtual {}\n\n    /**\n     * @notice ERC721 hook, called before all transfers including mint and burn\n     * @dev function should be overridden and new implementation must call super\n     * @param from sender of token\n     * @param to receiver of token\n     * @param tokenId id of transferred token\n     */\n    function _beforeTokenTransfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal virtual {}\n}\n","keccak256":"0xcc7bc3523871dc4f4e67c88f9c12931fd92d261de914144e749a1b71a3787dae","license":"MIT"},"@solidstate/contracts/token/ERC721/base/ERC721BaseStorage.sol":{"content":"// './ERC721MetadataStorage.sol';\n\n/**\n * @title ERC721Metadata internal functions\n */\nabstract contract ERC721MetadataInternal is\n    IERC721MetadataInternal,\n    ERC721BaseInternal\n{\n    using UintUtils for uint256;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice get token name\n     * @return token name\n     */\n    function _name() internal view virtual returns (string memory) {\n        return ERC721MetadataStorage.layout().name;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice get token symbol\n     * @return token symbol\n     */\n    function _symbol() internal view virtual returns (string memory) {\n        return ERC721MetadataStorage.layout().symbol;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice get generated URI for given token\n     * @return token URI\n     */\n    function _tokenURI(\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal view virtual returns (string memory) {\n        if (!_exists(tokenId)) revert ERC721Metadata__NonExistentToken();\n\n        ERC721MetadataStorage.Layout storage l = ERC721MetadataStorage.layout();\n\n        string memory tokenIdURI = l.tokenURIs[tokenId];\n        string memory baseURI = l.baseURI;\n\n        if (bytes(baseURI).length == 0) {\n            return tokenIdURI;\n        } else if (bytes(tokenIdURI).length > 0) {\n            return string(abi.encodePacked(baseURI, tokenIdURI));\n        } else {\n            return string(abi.encodePacked(baseURI, tokenId.toString()));\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice ERC721 hook: clear per-token URI data on burn\n     * @inheritdoc ERC721BaseInternal\n     */\n    function _beforeTokenTransfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal virtual override {\n        super._beforeTokenTransfer(from, to, tokenId);\n\n        if (to == address(0)) {\n            delete ERC721MetadataStorage.layout().tokenURIs[tokenId];\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xcd61c0be2e81ab0c140a5753d2bea656ad6ade067fe4b8994ce0bcc825feeaa2","license":"MIT"},"@solidstate/contracts/token/ERC721/metadata/ERC721MetadataStorage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nimport { UintUtils } from './UintUtils.sol';\n\nlibrary AddressUtils {\n    using UintUtils for uint256;\n\n    error AddressUtils__InsufficientBalance();\n    error AddressUtils__NotContract();\n    error AddressUtils__SendValueFailed();\n\n    function toString(address account) internal pure returns (string memory) {\n        return uint256(uint160(account)).toHexString(20);\n    }\n\n    function isContract(address account) internal view returns (bool) {\n        uint256 size;\n        assembly {\n            size := extcodesize(account)\n        }\n        return size > 0;\n    }\n\n    function sendValue(address payable account, uint256 amount) internal {\n        (bool success, ) = account.call{ value: amount }('');\n        if (!success) revert AddressUtils__SendValueFailed();\n    }\n\n    function functionCall(\n        address target,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) internal returns (bytes memory) {\n        return\n            functionCall(target, data, 'AddressUtils: failed low-level call');\n    }\n\n    function functionCall(\n        address target,\n        bytes memory data,\n        string memory error\n    ) internal returns (bytes memory) {\n        return _functionCallWithValue(target, data, 0, error);\n    }\n\n    function functionCallWithValue(\n        address target,\n        bytes memory data,\n        uint256 value\n    ) internal returns (bytes memory) {\n        return\n            functionCallWithValue(\n                target,\n                data,\n                value,\n                'AddressUtils: failed low-level call with value'\n            );\n    }\n\n    function functionCallWithValue(\n        address target,\n        bytes memory data,\n        uint256 value,\n        string memory error\n    ) internal returns (bytes memory) {\n        if (value > address(this).balance)\n            revert AddressUtils__InsufficientBalance();\n        return _functionCallWithValue(target, data, value, error);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice execute arbitrary external call with limited gas usage and amount of copied return data\n     * @dev derived from https://github.com/nomad-xyz/ExcessivelySafeCall (MIT License)\n     * @param target recipient of call\n     * @param gasAmount gas allowance for call\n     * @param value native token value to include in call\n     * @param maxCopy maximum number of bytes to copy from return data\n     * @param data encoded call data\n     * @return success whether call is successful\n     * @return returnData copied return data\n     */\n    function excessivelySafeCall(\n        address target,\n        uint256 gasAmount,\n        uint256 value,\n        uint16 maxCopy,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) internal returns (bool success, bytes memory returnData) {\n        returnData = new bytes(maxCopy);\n\n        assembly {\n            // execute external call via assembly to avoid automatic copying of return data\n            success := call(\n                gasAmount,\n                target,\n                value,\n                add(data, 0x20),\n                mload(data),\n                0,\n                0\n            )\n\n            // determine whether to limit amount of data to copy\n            let toCopy := returndatasize()\n\n            if gt(toCopy, maxCopy) {\n                toCopy := maxCopy\n            }\n\n            // store the length of the copied bytes\n            mstore(returnData, toCopy)\n\n            // copy the bytes from returndata[0:toCopy]\n            returndatacopy(add(returnData, 0x20), 0, toCopy)\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _functionCallWithValue(\n        address target,\n        bytes memory data,\n        uint256 value,\n        string memory error\n    ) private returns (bytes memory) {\n        if (!isContract(target)) revert AddressUtils__NotContract();\n\n        (bool success, bytes memory returnData) = target.call{ value: value }(\n            data\n        );\n\n        if (success) {\n            return returnData;\n        } else if (returnData.length > 0) {\n            assembly {\n                let returnData_size := mload(returnData)\n                revert(add(32, returnData), returnData_size)\n            }\n        } else {\n            revert(error);\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x7d924db4dbd9210923ab08db77db3c77438014c255fd49fa208ebce283d991bf","license":"MIT"},"@solidstate/contracts/utils/UintUtils.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\n/**\n * @title utility functions for uint256 operations\n * @dev derived from https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/ (MIT license)\n */\nlibrary UintUtils {\n    error UintUtils__InsufficientHexLength();\n\n    bytes16 private constant HEX_SYMBOLS = '0123456789abcdef';\n\n    function add(uint256 a, int256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        return b < 0 ? sub(a, -b) : a + uint256(b);\n    }\n\n    function sub(uint256 a, int256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {\n        return b < 0 ? add(a, -b) : a - uint256(b);\n    }\n\n    function toString(uint256 value) internal pure returns (string memory) {\n        if (value == 0) {\n            return '0';\n        }\n\n        uint256 temp = value;\n        uint256 digits;\n\n        while (temp != 0) {\n            digits++;\n            temp /= 10;\n        }\n\n        bytes memory buffer = new bytes(digits);\n\n        while (value != 0) {\n            digits -= 1;\n            buffer[digits] = bytes1(uint8(48 + uint256(value % 10)));\n            value /= 10;\n        }\n\n        return string(buffer);\n    }\n\n    function toHexString(uint256 value) internal pure returns (string memory) {\n        if (value == 0) {\n            return '0x00';\n        }\n\n        uint256 length = 0;\n\n        for (uint256 temp = value; temp != 0; temp >>= 8) {\n            unchecked {\n                length++;\n            }\n        }\n\n        return toHexString(value, length);\n    }\n\n    function toHexString(\n        uint256 value,\n        uint256 length\n    ) internal pure returns (string memory) {\n        bytes memory buffer = new bytes(2 * length + 2);\n        buffer[0] = '0';\n        buffer[1] = 'x';\n\n        unchecked {\n            for (uint256 i = 2 * length + 1; i > 1; --i) {\n                buffer[i] = HEX_SYMBOLS[value & 0xf];\n                value >>= 4;\n            }\n        }\n\n        if (value != 0) revert UintUtils__InsufficientHexLength();\n\n        return string(buffer);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x5aaeaea22a0800402c6f2d8ce6185293bc64f74f6c390c1b1c53b624b43972f8","license":"MIT"},"contracts/management/Management.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nimport \"./ManagementStorage.sol\";\n\nabstract contract Management {\n    function getManagerInfo() view external returns (address untradingManager, uint256 managerCut) {\n        ManagementStorage.Layout storage f = ManagementStorage.layout();\n        return (f.untradingManager, f.managerCut);\n    }\n\n    function setManagerCut(uint256 newManagerCut) external {\n        ManagementStorage.Layout storage f = ManagementStorage.layout();\n        require(msg.sender == f.untradingManager, \"Caller not permitted\");\n        f.managerCut = newManagerCut;\n    }\n}","keccak256":"0x48a8568075069ab9833d736d967ea67a1d022cbd4ea6e2e57a694f6a856cbb43","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/management/ManagementStorage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nlibrary ManagementStorage {\n    bytes32 internal constant STORAGE_SLOT = keccak256(\"untrading.unCryptoDiamond.facet.management.storage\");\n\n    struct Layout {\n        address untradingManager;\n        uint256 managerCut; // This is the cut of the oTokens that the untradingManager gets\n    }\n\n    function layout() internal pure returns (Layout storage l) {\n        bytes32 slot = STORAGE_SLOT;\n        assembly {\n            l.slot := slot\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xfd5aa3e753bbcd240f719643e3f98cc5a9020f1afad2b8315143fd6edfcc73c7","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/oTokens/oTokenStorage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nlibrary oTokenStorage {\n    bytes32 internal constant STORAGE_SLOT = keccak256(\"untrading.unCryptoDiamond.facet.otokens.storage\");\n\n    struct oToken {\n        uint256 ORatio; // The percentage of the profit\n        uint256 rewardRatio; // The percentage of profit allocated to both FR and OR\n        address paymentToken; // The address of the ERC20 token being used for payments or address(0) for chain native token.\n        address[] holders; // The addresses receiving the oToken cut of profit\n        mapping(address => uint256) amount; // The amount of tokens each holder has\n    }\n\n    struct Layout {\n        // It will be quite easy to solve our current issue, we create a mapping that is uint256 => oToken, then we assign a variable (oTokenId) or mapping for uint256 => uint256, this would be the tokenId => oTokenId, then we just pull the oTokenId to get the oToken struct. 2 calls to get the oToken info, we don't need to change anything as we can make the oTokenId the same as the tokenId during mint time, so in the future, different split tokens will have the same oTokenId which is just the original tokenId\n\n        mapping(uint256 => oToken) _oTokens; // Mapping that represents the oToken information for a given oTokenId\n\n        mapping(uint256 => uint256) _oTokenId; // Mapping that represents the tokenId => oTokenId\n\n        mapping(address => uint256) _allottedOR; // Mapping that represents the OR (in Ether) allotted for a given address\n\n        mapping(address => mapping(address => uint256)) _allottedERC20Tokens; // Mapping that represents the FR + OR allotted for a given address and in which token\n    }\n\n    function layout() internal pure returns (Layout storage l) {\n        bytes32 slot = STORAGE_SLOT;\n        assembly {\n            l.slot := slot\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xe7df78efc9301ad9730535e94073098d1eee87eef5e83be5788b66b7f2804d41","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/unFacet/IunFacet.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nimport \"@solidstate/contracts/interfaces/IERC165.sol\";\n\n/*\n *\n * @dev Interface for the untrading unFacet.\n *\n */\ninterface IunFacet is IERC165 {\n\n    event ORClaimed(address indexed account, uint256 indexed amount);\n\n    event ERC20RewardsClaimed(address indexed account, address indexed token, uint256 indexed amount);\n\n    event ORDistributed(uint256 indexed tokenId, uint256 indexed allocatedOR);\n\n    event OTokenTransfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint256 indexed tokenId);\n\n    event OTokensDistributed(uint256 indexed tokenId);\n\n    event Wrapped(address indexed account, uint256 indexed tokenAmount, address paymentToken);\n\n    event Unwrapped(uint256 indexed tokenId, uint256 indexed amount);\n\n    function wrap(address to, uint256 tokenAmount, address paymentToken, uint8 numGenerations, uint256 rewardRatio, uint256 ORatio) external returns (uint256);\n\n    function unwrap(address to, uint256 tokenId, uint8 sigV, bytes32 sigR, bytes32 sigS) external;\n\n    function transferOTokens(address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) external;\n\n    function releaseOR(address payable account) external;\n\n    function releaseAllottedTokens(address account, address token) external;\n\n    function getORInfo(uint256 tokenId) external view returns(uint256, uint256, address, address[] memory);\n\n    function getAllottedOR(address account) external view returns(uint256);\n\n    function getAllottedTokens(address account, address token) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function balanceOfOTokens(uint256 tokenId, address account) external view returns(uint256);\n\n    function getUnderlyingTokenAddress() external view returns (address);\n}","keccak256":"0xf31af3d7057be3667d5aecfa992f6860208a43c3cd92cd93c9017318ed2945b0","license":"GPL-2.0-or-later"},"contracts/unFacet/unFacet.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nimport { SolidStateERC721 } from \"@solidstate/contracts/token/ERC721/SolidStateERC721.sol\";\nimport { ERC721MetadataStorage } from \"@solidstate/contracts/token/ERC721/metadata/ERC721MetadataStorage.sol\";\nimport { IERC20 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\nimport { SafeERC20 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport { IERC721Receiver } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/IERC721Receiver.sol\";\n\nimport \"@prb/math/contracts/PRBMathUD60x18.sol\";\n\nimport \"lib/ERC5173-Divisible-Diamond/contracts/nFR/nFR.sol\";\n\n// import { CounterStorage } from \"../utils/CounterStorage.sol\"; //? Do we want to use the nFR CounterStorage or our own? Basically the only difference is storage slot location.\n\nimport \"../oTokens/oTokenStorage.sol\";\nimport \"../wrapping/WrappingStorage.sol\";\nimport { UnwrappingStorage } from \"../unwrapping/UnwrappingStorage.sol\";\n\nimport \"../management/Management.sol\";\nimport \"./IunFacet.sol\";\n\ncontract unFacet is nFR, Management, IunFacet {\n    using CounterStorage for CounterStorage.Layout;\n\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20;\n    using PRBMathUD60x18 for uint256;\n\n    function getORInfo(uint256 tokenId) external view override returns (uint256 ORatio, uint256 rewardRatio, address paymentToken, address[] memory holders) {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[o._oTokenId[tokenId]];\n\n        return (oToken.ORatio, oToken.rewardRatio, oToken.paymentToken, oToken.holders);\n    }\n\n    function getAllottedOR(address account) external view override returns (uint256) {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n        return (o._allottedOR[account]);\n    }\n\n    function getAllottedTokens(address account, address token) external view override returns (uint256) {\n        return (oTokenStorage.layout()._allottedERC20Tokens[account][token]);\n    }\n\n    function balanceOfOTokens(uint256 tokenId, address account) external view override returns (uint256) {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        uint256 oTokenId = o._oTokenId[tokenId];\n\n        return (o._oTokens[oTokenId].amount[account]);\n    }\n\n    function getUnderlyingTokenAddress() external view override returns (address) {\n        WrappingStorage.Layout storage w = WrappingStorage.layout();\n        return (w.underlyingTokenAddress);\n    }\n\n    function _mint(\n        address to,\n        uint256 amount,\n        address paymentToken,\n        uint8 numGenerations,\n        uint256 rewardRatio,\n        uint256 ORatio\n    ) internal returns(uint256 tokenId) { \n        require(numGenerations >= 5 && numGenerations <= 20, \"numGenerations must be between 5 and 20\");\n        require(rewardRatio >= 5e16 && rewardRatio <= 5e17, \"rewardRatio must be between 5% and 50%\");\n        require(ORatio >= 5e16 && ORatio <= 5e17, \"ORatio must be between 5% and 50%\");\n\n        uint256 successiveRatio = ((uint256(numGenerations) * 1e18).div((uint256(numGenerations) * 1e18) - 1.618e18)) / 100 * 100; // by ( / 100 * 100) we are effectively rounding down the successive ratio. The division takes advantage of Solidity's automatic decimal truncation, effectively removing the last 2 digits, then the multiplication adds those 2 digits back as 0s.\n        uint256 percentOfProfit = rewardRatio.mul(1e18 - ORatio);\n\n        ORatio = rewardRatio.mul(ORatio);\n\n        CounterStorage.incrementTokenId();\n\n        uint256 newTokenId = CounterStorage.layout().tokenIds;\n        _distributeOTokens(to, newTokenId, ORatio, rewardRatio, paymentToken);\n        _mint(to, newTokenId, amount, numGenerations, percentOfProfit, successiveRatio);\n\n        tokenId = newTokenId;\n    }\n\n    function wrap(\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenAmount,\n        address paymentToken,\n        uint8 numGenerations,\n        uint256 rewardRatio,\n        uint256 ORatio\n    ) external override returns(uint256) {\n        WrappingStorage.Layout storage w = WrappingStorage.layout();\n\n        uint256 adjustedTokenAmount = tokenAmount * (10 ** (18 - w.underlyingTokenDecimals)); // Adjust the decimals of the token to ensure that the token amounts are always in 18 decimals.\n\n        uint256 tokenId = _mint(to, adjustedTokenAmount, paymentToken, numGenerations, rewardRatio, ORatio);\n\n        IERC20(w.underlyingTokenAddress).safeTransferFrom(_msgSender(), address(this), tokenAmount);\n\n        emit Wrapped(to, tokenAmount, paymentToken);\n\n        return tokenId;\n    }\n\n    function unwrap(address to, uint256 tokenId, uint8 sigV, bytes32 sigR, bytes32 sigS) external override {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage n = nFRStorage.layout();\n        WrappingStorage.Layout storage w = WrappingStorage.layout();\n\n        require(_isApprovedOrOwner(_msgSender(), tokenId), \"Caller is not owner of token\");\n\n        if (n._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].ownerAmount != 1) {\n            UnwrappingStorage.Layout storage u = UnwrappingStorage.layout();\n\n            bytes32 inputHash = keccak256(abi.encode(UnwrappingStorage.TXTYPE_HASH, to, tokenId));\n            bytes32 totalHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(\"\\x19\\x01\", u.DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, inputHash));\n\n            address recovered = ecrecover(totalHash, sigV, sigR, sigS);\n\n            ManagementStorage.Layout storage m = ManagementStorage.layout();\n            oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n            uint256 oTokenId = o._oTokenId[tokenId];\n\n            oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[oTokenId];\n\n            address largestOTokenHolder;\n\n            for (uint i = 0; i < oToken.holders.length; i++) {\n                if (oToken.amount[oToken.holders[i]] > oToken.amount[largestOTokenHolder]) { // Only forseeable problem is if the oToken holders are split or tied, e.g. [0.1, 0.45, 0.45] In this config only the middle address' sig would need be approved.\n                    largestOTokenHolder = oToken.holders[i];\n                }\n            }\n\n            require(recovered == m.untradingManager || recovered == largestOTokenHolder, \"Invalid signature provided\");\n        }\n\n        address underlyingTokenAddress = w.underlyingTokenAddress;\n        uint256 amount = n._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount / (10 ** (18 - w.underlyingTokenDecimals)); // Remove any additional decimals the contract might have added\n\n        _burn(tokenId);\n\n        IERC20(underlyingTokenAddress).safeTransfer(to, amount);\n\n        emit Unwrapped(tokenId, amount);\n    }\n\n    function releaseOR(address payable account) external override {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n        require(o._allottedOR[account] > 0, \"No OR Payment due\");\n\n        uint256 ORAmount = o._allottedOR[account];\n\n        o._allottedOR[account] = 0;\n\n        (bool sent, ) = account.call{value: ORAmount}(\"\");\n        require(sent, \"Failed to release OR\");\n\n        emit ORClaimed(account, ORAmount);\n    }\n\n    function releaseAllottedTokens(address account, address token) external override {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n        require(o._allottedERC20Tokens[account][token] > 0, \"No Payment due\");\n\n        uint256 paymentAmount = o._allottedERC20Tokens[account][token];\n\n        o._allottedERC20Tokens[account][token] = 0;\n\n        IERC20(token).safeTransfer(account, paymentAmount);\n\n        emit ERC20RewardsClaimed(account, token, paymentAmount);\n    }\n\n    function transferOTokens(address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) external override {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        require(to != address(0), \"transfer to the zero address\");\n        require(to != _msgSender(), \"transfer to self\");\n        require(amount > 0, \"transfer amount is 0\");\n\n        oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[o._oTokenId[tokenId]];\n\n        uint256 fromBalance = oToken.amount[_msgSender()];\n        require(fromBalance >= amount, \"transfer amount exceeds balance\");\n\n        unchecked {\n            oToken.amount[_msgSender()] = fromBalance - amount;\n            // Overflow not possible: the sum of all balances is capped by 1e18 (100%), and is preserved by\n            // decrementing then incrementing.\n            oToken.amount[to] += amount;\n        }\n\n        if (fromBalance - amount == 0) {\n            for (uint256 i = 0; i < oToken.holders.length; i++) {\n                if (oToken.holders[i] == _msgSender()) {\n                    oToken.holders[i] = to;\n                    return;\n                }\n            }\n            revert(\"Not Found\");\n        } else {\n            oToken.holders.push(to);\n        }\n\n        emit OTokenTransfer(_msgSender(), to, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _distributeOTokens(address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 ORatio, uint256 rewardRatio, address paymentToken) internal {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n        ManagementStorage.Layout storage m = ManagementStorage.layout();\n\n        oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[tokenId];\n\n        o._oTokenId[tokenId] = tokenId; // Set the oTokenId for the token for identification\n        \n        oToken.ORatio = ORatio;\n        oToken.rewardRatio = rewardRatio;\n        oToken.paymentToken = paymentToken;\n        oToken.holders = [m.untradingManager, to];\n        oToken.amount[m.untradingManager] = m.managerCut;\n        oToken.amount[to] = (1e18 - m.managerCut);\n\n        emit OTokensDistributed(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _distributeOR(uint256 tokenId, uint256 profit) internal returns(uint256 allocatedOR) {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[o._oTokenId[tokenId]];\n\n        uint256 ORAvailable = profit.mul(oToken.ORatio);\n\n        for (uint holder = 0; holder < oToken.holders.length; holder++) {\n            address holderAddress = oToken.holders[holder];\n\n            if (oToken.paymentToken == address(0)) {\n                o._allottedOR[holderAddress] += ORAvailable.mul(oToken.amount[holderAddress]);\n            } else {\n                o._allottedERC20Tokens[holderAddress][oToken.paymentToken] += ORAvailable.mul(oToken.amount[holderAddress]);\n            }\n        }\n\n        allocatedOR = ORAvailable;\n\n        emit ORDistributed(tokenId, ORAvailable);\n    }\n\n    function _distributeFR(uint256 tokenId, uint256 profit) internal override returns(uint256 allocatedFR) {\n        uint256 allocatedOR = _distributeOR(tokenId, profit);\n        uint256 allocated = super._distributeFR(tokenId, profit);\n\n        allocatedFR = (allocated + allocatedOR);\n    }\n\n    function buy(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) public payable virtual override {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[o._oTokenId[tokenId]];\n\n        if (oToken.paymentToken == address(0)) {\n            super.buy(tokenId, amount);\n        } else {\n            nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n            uint256 transactionValue = (amount).mul(l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].salePrice); // Sale price should be determined based on the amount supplied into the buy function, (buyAmount) * salePrice\n\n            IERC20(oToken.paymentToken).safeTransferFrom(_msgSender(), address(this), transactionValue); //* Need to assess if calling transferFrom here is the best approach, versus a more complete refactor for safety reasons. We could convert _payLister to a pull-payment system in both nFR for ETH and here for ERC20, and then we would be able to call IERC20.transferFrom at the end of this buy override.\n\n            _buy(tokenId, amount, true);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _payLister(uint256 tokenId, address lister, uint256 paymentAmount) internal virtual override {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[o._oTokenId[tokenId]];\n\n        if (oToken.paymentToken == address(0)) {\n            super._payLister(tokenId, lister, paymentAmount);\n        } else {\n            IERC20(oToken.paymentToken).safeTransfer(lister, paymentAmount); // Since _payLister is only called when soldPrice > 0, you will never be transferring 0. \n        }\n    }\n\n    function _allocateFR(uint256 tokenId, address owner, uint256 FR) internal virtual override {\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        oTokenStorage.oToken storage oToken = o._oTokens[o._oTokenId[tokenId]];\n\n        if (oToken.paymentToken == address(0)) {\n            super._allocateFR(tokenId, owner, FR);\n        } else {\n            oTokenStorage.layout()._allottedERC20Tokens[owner][oToken.paymentToken] += FR;\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _createSplitToken(address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, uint256 soldPrice) internal virtual override returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 newTokenId = super._createSplitToken(to, tokenId, amount, soldPrice);\n\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n        \n        o._oTokenId[newTokenId] = o._oTokenId[tokenId];\n\n        return newTokenId;\n    }\n\n    function _burn(uint256 tokenId) internal override {\n        super._burn(tokenId);\n        oTokenStorage.Layout storage o = oTokenStorage.layout();\n\n        delete o._oTokenId[tokenId];\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x1a0c93bf9b0c72bea71a0c0b5cd996820dbc63aa6d5a26cc59b40c1545716af5","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/unwrapping/UnwrappingStorage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nlibrary UnwrappingStorage {\n    bytes32 internal constant STORAGE_SLOT = keccak256(\"untrading.unCryptoDiamond.facet.ERC20.unwrapping.storage\");\n\n    bytes32 constant EIP712DOMAINTYPE_HASH = keccak256(\"EIP712Domain(string name,string version,uint256 chainId,address verifyingContract,bytes32 salt)\");\n\n    bytes32 constant VERSION_HASH = keccak256(\"1\");\n\n    bytes32 constant TXTYPE_HASH = keccak256(\"Unwrap(address to,uint256 tokenId)\");\n\n    // keccak256(\"untradingcrypto\")\n    bytes32 constant SALT = 0xc25ebea6dd97ec30f15ce845010d7e9fee0398194f29ee544b5062c074544590;\n\n    struct Layout {\n        bytes32 DOMAIN_SEPARATOR;\n    }\n\n    function layout() internal pure returns (Layout storage l) {\n        bytes32 slot = STORAGE_SLOT;\n        assembly {\n            l.slot := slot\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xf715165ed0ce54e4a3d483f1d6890e8a71d7c660bb48190d7c175ccc92d8b524","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/wrapping/WrappingStorage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nlibrary WrappingStorage {\n    bytes32 internal constant STORAGE_SLOT = keccak256(\"untrading.unCryptoDiamond.facet.ERC20.wrapping.storage\");\n\n    struct Layout {\n        // Every token in this contract is assumed to be wrapped, so there is no need for another underlyingAmount variable or an isWrapped bool.\n        address underlyingTokenAddress;\n        uint8 underlyingTokenDecimals;\n    }\n\n    function layout() internal pure returns (Layout storage l) {\n        bytes32 slot = STORAGE_SLOT;\n        assembly {\n            l.slot := slot\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x063dc58d5d326b3e291e8fcd0b71c4548e0a0689e7702c55f4c35b991ecb207d","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"lib/ERC5173-Divisible-Diamond/contracts/nFR/InFR.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nimport \"@solidstate/contracts/interfaces/IERC165.sol\";\n\n/*\n *\n * @dev Interface for the Future Rewards Token Standard.\n *\n * A standardized way to receive future rewards for non-fungible tokens (NFTs.)\n *\n */\ninterface InFR is IERC165 {\n\n    event FRClaimed(address indexed account, uint256 indexed amount);\n\n    event FRDistributed(uint256 indexed tokenId, uint256 indexed allocatedFR);\n\n    event Transferred(uint256 indexed tokenId, uint256 indexed amount, int256 indexed profit, uint256 newTokenId);\n\n    event Listed(uint256 indexed tokenId, uint256 indexed salePrice);\n\n    event Unlisted(uint256 indexed tokenId);\n\n    event Bought(uint256 indexed tokenId, uint256 indexed salePrice, uint256 indexed saleAmount);\n\n    function list(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, uint256 salePrice) external;\n\n    function unlist(uint256 tokenId) external;\n\n    function buy(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) payable external;\n\n    function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) external;\n\n    function approve(address operator, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) external;\n\n    function releaseFR(address payable account) external;\n\n    function getFRInfo(uint256 tokenId) external view returns(uint8, uint256, uint256, uint256, uint256, address[] memory);\n\n    function getAllottedFR(address account) external view returns(uint256);\n\n    function getListInfo(uint256 tokenId) external view returns(uint256, uint256, address, bool);\n\n    function getAssetInfo(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function getApprovedAmount(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256);\n    \n}","keccak256":"0x8f504bcdaa290b3fe295f4a8e99ef3a151bdcb59b39c93111bdce537f7e744fc","license":"GPL-2.0-or-later"},"lib/ERC5173-Divisible-Diamond/contracts/nFR/nFR.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nimport \"./InFR.sol\";\nimport \"./nFRStorage.sol\";\nimport \"@solidstate/contracts/token/ERC721/SolidStateERC721.sol\";\nimport \"@prb/math/contracts/PRBMathUD60x18.sol\";\nimport \"@prb/math/contracts/PRBMathSD59x18.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol\";\n\nimport { ERC721BaseStorage } from \"@solidstate/contracts/token/ERC721/base/ERC721BaseStorage.sol\";\n\nimport {CounterStorage} from \"../utils/CounterStorage.sol\";\n\nabstract contract nFR is InFR, SolidStateERC721 {\n    using PRBMathUD60x18 for uint256;\n    using PRBMathSD59x18 for int256;\n\n    using CounterStorage for CounterStorage.Layout;\n\n    function getFRInfo(uint256 tokenId)\n        external\n        view\n        virtual\n        override\n        returns (\n            uint8 numGenerations,\n            uint256 percentOfProfit,\n            uint256 successiveRatio,\n            uint256 lastSoldPrice,\n            uint256 ownerAmount,\n            address[] memory addressesInFR\n        )\n    {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n        return (l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].numGenerations, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].percentOfProfit, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].successiveRatio, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].lastSoldPrice, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].ownerAmount, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].addressesInFR);\n    }\n\n    function getListInfo(uint256 tokenId)\n        external\n        view\n        virtual\n        override\n        returns (\n            uint256,\n            uint256,\n            address,\n            bool\n        )\n    {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n        return (l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].salePrice, l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].saleAmount, l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].lister, l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].isListed);\n    }\n\n    function getAssetInfo(uint256 tokenId) \n        external\n        view\n        virtual\n        override\n        returns (\n            uint256\n        )\n    {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n        return (l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount);\n    }\n\n    function getAllottedFR(address account) external view virtual override returns (uint256) {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n        return l._allottedFR[account];\n    }\n\n    function getApprovedAmount(uint256 tokenId) external view virtual returns(uint256) {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        return l._tokenApprovalAmounts[tokenId];\n    }\n\n    function _isApprovedOrOwner(address spender, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) internal view virtual returns (bool) {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        if (!_exists(tokenId)) revert ERC721Base__NonExistentToken();\n\n        address owner = _ownerOf(tokenId);\n\n        return (\n            (spender == owner) ||\n            (_getApproved(tokenId) == spender && l._tokenApprovalAmounts[tokenId] >= amount) ||\n            (_isApprovedForAll(owner, spender))\n        );\n    }\n\n    function list(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, uint256 salePrice) public virtual override {\n        require(_isApprovedOrOwner(_msgSender(), tokenId), \"ERC5173: list caller is not owner nor approved\");\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        require(amount <= l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount, \"amount is too large\");\n\n        l._tokenListInfo[tokenId] = nFRStorage.ListInfo(salePrice, amount, _msgSender(), true);\n\n        emit Listed(tokenId, salePrice);\n    }\n\n    function unlist(uint256 tokenId) public virtual override {\n        require(_isApprovedOrOwner(_msgSender(), tokenId), \"ERC5173: unlist caller is not owner nor approved\");\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        delete l._tokenListInfo[tokenId];\n\n        emit Unlisted(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function buy(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) public payable virtual override { //? Maybe add a *to* parameter\n        _buy(tokenId, amount, false);\n    }\n\n    function _buy(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, bool bypassValueCheck) internal virtual { //* The boolean is for custom msg.value checks or different payment methods (such as ERC20)\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n        require(l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].isListed == true, \"Token is not listed\");\n        require(amount <= l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].saleAmount, \"Buy amount exceeds list amount\");\n\n        uint256 salePrice = l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].salePrice;\n\n        uint256 transactionValue = (amount).mul(salePrice); // Sale price should be determined based on the amount supplied into the buy function, (buyAmount) * salePrice\n\n        require(bypassValueCheck || transactionValue == msg.value, \"salePrice and msg.value mismatch\");\n\n        _transferFrom(l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].lister, _msgSender(), tokenId, amount, transactionValue);\n\n        emit Bought(tokenId, salePrice, amount);\n    }\n\n    function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) public virtual {\n        require(_isApprovedOrOwner(_msgSender(), tokenId, amount), \"caller is not owner nor approved\");\n\n        _transfer(from, to, tokenId, amount);\n    }\n\n    function approve(address operator, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount) public virtual {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        require(amount <= l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount, \"Approval amount exceeds asset amount\");\n\n        ERC721BaseInternal._approve(operator, tokenId); // ERC721 approve handles the remaining logic\n\n        l._tokenApprovalAmounts[tokenId] = amount;\n    }\n\n    function _isApprovedOrOwner(address spender, uint256 tokenId) internal view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        return (_isApprovedOrOwner(spender, tokenId, l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount)); // ERC721 call, so either approved with ERC721 method or max amount\n    }\n\n    function _approve(address operator, uint256 tokenId) internal virtual override {\n        super._approve(operator, tokenId);\n\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        l._tokenApprovalAmounts[tokenId] = l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount;\n    }\n\n    function _transfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) internal virtual {\n        _transferFrom(from, to, tokenId, amount, 0); // 0 sold price as it is just a transfer.\n    }\n\n    function _transfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) internal virtual override {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        _transfer(from, to, tokenId, l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount);\n    }\n\n    function _transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, uint256 transactionValue) internal virtual {\n        require(from != to, \"transfer to self\");\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        require(amount <= l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount, \"amount is too large\"); //* This check is done in list, however, when other transfer functions are calling it there is no guard. So this serves as one.\n\n        for (uint i = 0; i < l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].addressesInFR.length; i++) { // Could use an isInFR mapping if it is cheaper\n            require(l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].addressesInFR[i] != to, \"Already in the FR sliding window\");\n        }\n\n        uint256 allocatedFR = 0;\n\n        uint256 salePrice = l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].salePrice;\n\n        // Could make the profit formula a helper function in the nFRStorage library\n        int256 profit = (int256(salePrice) - int256(l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].lastSoldPrice)).mul(int256(amount)); // Calculate profit by comparing unit prices\n\n        if (profit > 0) { // NFT sold for a profit\n            allocatedFR = _distributeFR(tokenId, uint256(profit));\n        }\n\n        uint256 newTokenId; //? Do we even need this if we aren't using it anywhere? We could emit it. We could also emit profit.\n\n        if (amount != l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount) {\n            // Mint a new token that clones the FR info, then deducts the amount from the current token, then we set the newTokenId\n            newTokenId = _createSplitToken(to, tokenId, amount, salePrice);\n\n            l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount -= amount;\n\n            ERC721BaseStorage.layout().tokenApprovals[tokenId] = address(0); // Remove approved address on partial transfer, it is already removed on whole transfer by ERC721 transfer\n        } else {\n            // Whole NFT has been transferred\n            ERC721BaseInternal._transfer(from, to, tokenId);\n            require(_checkOnERC721Received(from, to, tokenId, \"\"), \"ERC721: transfer to non ERC721Receiver implementer\");\n\n            l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].lastSoldPrice = salePrice; // Should not be updating this if the transfer is not whole. Otherwise, you can sell 0.1 tokens at 1000, then sell 0.9 tokens at 1000 paying 0 FR.\n            l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].ownerAmount++;\n\n            _shiftGenerations(to, tokenId);\n        }\n\n        l._tokenApprovalAmounts[tokenId] = 0; // Reset token approvals on transfer, I don't believe we need a decrementing system as the approvals are meant to be more of a one-off type of transaction, if an approved address is to make more than a couple transactions, they should be approved with setApprovalForAll. Though if there is a need, this could be easily changed to a decrement system as it is just how you modify storage slots and is implementation related.\n\n        address lister = l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].lister;\n\n        if (l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].isListed && amount < l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].saleAmount) { // If the token sold a partial amount\n            l._tokenListInfo[tokenId].saleAmount -= amount;\n        } else { // If the entire list was fulfilled or the token isn't listed, delete everything\n            delete l._tokenListInfo[tokenId];\n        }\n\n        if (transactionValue > 0)\n            _payLister(tokenId, lister, transactionValue - allocatedFR);\n\n        emit Transferred(tokenId, amount, profit, newTokenId);\n    }\n\n    function _payLister(uint256 /*tokenId*/, address lister, uint256 paymentAmount) internal virtual { //* This function is for custom payment logic or different payment methods (such as ERC20), it allows overriding the payment logic.\n        (bool sent, ) = payable(lister).call{value: paymentAmount}(\"\"); // This (push) is more convenient for the user and is safe enough, if a contract that doesn't accept ether lists a token and it fails in this function, it is not detrimental to the rest of the contract.\n        require(sent, \"ERC5173: Failed to send ETH to lister\");\n    }\n\n    function _createSplitToken(address to, uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount, uint256 soldPrice) internal virtual returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 newTokenId = _incrementSplitTokenId();\n\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        nFRStorage.FRInfo memory tokenFRInfo = l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId]; // Needed or else Stack Too Deep error\n\n        _mint(to, newTokenId, amount, tokenFRInfo.numGenerations, tokenFRInfo.percentOfProfit, tokenFRInfo.successiveRatio, soldPrice, tokenFRInfo.ownerAmount + 1, tokenFRInfo.addressesInFR);\n\n        return newTokenId;\n    }\n\n    function _incrementSplitTokenId() internal virtual returns (uint256) { //* Inheriting contracts should override this function, unless using the same Counter Storage at the same storage slot\n        CounterStorage.incrementTokenId();\n\n        return CounterStorage.currentTokenId();\n    }\n\n    function _mint(address to, uint256 tokenId) internal virtual override { // On a side note, do we even need default info? We could just revert on this function call\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        require(l._defaultFRInfo.isValid, \"No Default FR Info has been set\");\n        require(l._defaultAssetInfo.amount > 0, \"No Default Asset Info has been set\");\n\n        super._mint(to, tokenId);\n\n        l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId] = nFRStorage.FRInfo(l._defaultFRInfo.numGenerations, l._defaultFRInfo.percentOfProfit, l._defaultFRInfo.successiveRatio, 0, 1, new address[](0), true);\n\n        l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].addressesInFR.push(to);\n\n        l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId] = l._defaultAssetInfo;\n    }\n\n    function _mint(\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 amount,\n        uint8 numGenerations,\n        uint256 percentOfProfit,\n        uint256 successiveRatio\n    ) internal virtual {\n        _mint(to, tokenId, amount, numGenerations, percentOfProfit, successiveRatio, 0, 1, new address[](0));\n    }\n\n    function _mint(\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 amount,\n        uint8 numGenerations,\n        uint256 percentOfProfit,\n        uint256 successiveRatio,\n        uint256 lastSoldPrice,\n        uint256 ownerAmount,\n        address[] memory addressesInFR\n    ) internal virtual {\n        require(numGenerations > 0 && percentOfProfit > 0 && percentOfProfit <= 1e18 && successiveRatio > 0 && amount > 0 && ownerAmount > 0, \"Invalid Data Passed\");\n\n        ERC721BaseInternal._mint(to, tokenId);\n        require(_checkOnERC721Received(address(0), to, tokenId, \"\"), \"ERC721: transfer to non ERC721Receiver implementer\");\n\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId] = nFRStorage.FRInfo(numGenerations, percentOfProfit, successiveRatio, lastSoldPrice, ownerAmount, addressesInFR, true);\n\n        _shiftGenerations(to, tokenId); // Functionally equivalent to pushing addressInFR, however, takes into account calls providing a non-empty addressesInFR\n\n        l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId].amount = amount;\n    }\n\n    function _distributeFR(uint256 tokenId, uint256 profit) internal virtual returns(uint256 allocatedFR) {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        if (l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].ownerAmount == 1) // Make sure the minter isn't paying themselves.\n            return 0;\n   \n        uint256[] memory FR = _calculateFR(profit, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].percentOfProfit, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].successiveRatio, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].ownerAmount - 1, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].numGenerations - 1); // Deduct one from numGenerations and ownerAmount because otherwise it'll create the distribution with an extra person in mind, therefore, paying the newest person in the FR cycle who has just sold.\n\n        for (uint owner = 0; owner < FR.length; owner++) {\n            _allocateFR(tokenId, l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].addressesInFR[owner], FR[owner]);\n        }\n\n        allocatedFR = profit.mul(l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].percentOfProfit);\n\n        emit FRDistributed(tokenId, allocatedFR);\n    }\n\n    function _allocateFR(uint256 /*tokenId*/, address owner, uint256 FR) internal virtual {\n        nFRStorage.layout()._allottedFR[owner] += FR;\n    }\n\n    function _shiftGenerations(address to, uint256 tokenId) internal virtual {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        address[] storage addressesInFR = l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].addressesInFR;\n\n        if (addressesInFR.length < l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId].numGenerations) { // We just want to push to the array\n            addressesInFR.push(to);\n        } else { // We want to remove the first element in the array and then push to the end of the array\n            for (uint i = 0; i < addressesInFR.length-1; i++) {\n                addressesInFR[i] = addressesInFR[i+1];\n            }\n\n            addressesInFR[addressesInFR.length-1] = to; // Functionally equivalent to popping then pushing.\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _setDefaultFRInfo(\n        uint8 numGenerations,\n        uint256 percentOfProfit,\n        uint256 successiveRatio\n    ) internal virtual { // If we decide to scrap defaults then we should delete this func and _setDefaultAssetInfo\n        require(numGenerations > 0 && percentOfProfit > 0 && percentOfProfit <= 1e18 && successiveRatio > 0, \"Invalid Data Passed\");\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        l._defaultFRInfo.numGenerations = numGenerations;\n        l._defaultFRInfo.percentOfProfit = percentOfProfit;\n        l._defaultFRInfo.successiveRatio = successiveRatio;\n        l._defaultFRInfo.isValid = true;\n    }\n\n    function _setDefaultAssetInfo(uint256 amount) internal virtual { // Delete func if we end up scraping defaults\n        require(amount > 0, \"Invalid Data Passed\");\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        l._defaultAssetInfo.amount = amount;\n    }\n\n    function _burn(uint256 tokenId) internal virtual override {\n        super._burn(tokenId);\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n\n        delete l._tokenFRInfo[tokenId];\n        delete l._tokenListInfo[tokenId];\n        delete l._tokenAssetInfo[tokenId];\n        delete l._tokenApprovalAmounts[tokenId];\n    }\n\n    function releaseFR(address payable account) public virtual override {\n        nFRStorage.Layout storage l = nFRStorage.layout();\n        require(l._allottedFR[account] > 0, \"No FR Payment due\");\n\n        uint256 FRAmount = l._allottedFR[account];\n\n        l._allottedFR[account] = 0;\n\n        (bool sent, ) = account.call{value: FRAmount}(\"\");\n        require(sent, \"Failed to release FR\");\n\n        emit FRClaimed(account, FRAmount);\n    }\n\n    function _calculateFR(\n        uint256 totalProfit,\n        uint256 buyerReward,\n        uint256 successiveRatio,\n        uint256 ownerAmount,\n        uint256 windowSize\n    ) internal pure virtual returns (uint256[] memory) {\n        uint256 n = Math.min(ownerAmount, windowSize);\n        uint256[] memory FR = new uint256[](n);\n\n        for (uint256 i = 1; i < n + 1; i++) { // There have to be some optimizations we could make\n            uint256 pi = 0;\n\n            if (successiveRatio != 1e18) {\n                int256 v1 = 1e18 - int256(successiveRatio).powu(n);\n                int256 v2 = int256(successiveRatio).powu(i - 1);\n                int256 v3 = int256(totalProfit).mul(int256(buyerReward));\n                int256 v4 = v3.mul(1e18 - int256(successiveRatio));\n                pi = uint256(v4 * v2 / v1);\n            } else {\n                pi = totalProfit.mul(buyerReward).div(n);\n            }\n\n            FR[n - i] = pi;\n        }\n\n        return FR;\n    }\n\n    function _msgSender() internal view virtual returns (address) {\n        return msg.sender;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x654b34677cc68b8e32b8194efc215c95b4c736efc77f58195b266a0856ca1567","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"lib/ERC5173-Divisible-Diamond/contracts/nFR/nFRStorage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nlibrary nFRStorage {\n    bytes32 internal constant STORAGE_SLOT = keccak256(\"5173.diamond.NFT.nFR.contract.storage\");\n\n    struct FRInfo {\n        uint8 numGenerations; // Number of generations corresponding to that Token ID\n        uint256 percentOfProfit; // Percent of profit allocated for FR, scaled by 1e18\n        uint256 successiveRatio; // The common ratio of successive in the geometric sequence, used for distribution calculation\n        uint256 lastSoldPrice; // Last unit sale price in ETH mantissa\n        uint256 ownerAmount; // Amount of owners the Token ID has seen\n        address[] addressesInFR; // The addresses currently in the FR cycle\n        bool isValid; // Updated by contract and signifies if an FR Info for a given Token ID is valid\n    }\n\n    struct ListInfo {\n        uint256 salePrice; // ETH mantissa of the listed selling price\n        uint256 saleAmount; // Amount of tokens being sold\n        // uint256 maxPartial; // Max amount that can be sold partially // Though at the same time it might be easier to do bool isPartial. //? What's the use case of specifiying the maximum amount that can be sold partially in your listing?\n        address lister; // Owner/Lister of the Token\n        bool isListed; // Boolean indicating whether the Token is listed or not\n    }\n\n    struct AssetInfo {\n        uint256 amount;\n    }\n\n    struct Layout {\n        FRInfo _defaultFRInfo;\n        AssetInfo _defaultAssetInfo;\n        \n        mapping(uint256 => FRInfo) _tokenFRInfo;\n\n        mapping(uint256 => ListInfo) _tokenListInfo;\n\n        mapping(uint256 => AssetInfo) _tokenAssetInfo;\n\n        mapping(uint256 => uint256) _tokenApprovalAmounts; // tokenId => approved amount - To be used in conjunction with ERC721 _tokenApprovals.\n\n        mapping(address => uint256) _allottedFR;\n    }\n\n    function layout() internal pure returns (Layout storage l) {\n        bytes32 slot = STORAGE_SLOT;\n        assembly {\n            l.slot := slot\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x77eb061d31b92ef2ae76786dfb450698bb302fd06468e2c864aa2b92184b80c7","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"lib/ERC5173-Divisible-Diamond/contracts/utils/CounterStorage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.8;\n\nlibrary CounterStorage {\n    bytes32 internal constant STORAGE_SLOT = keccak256(\"counter.storage\");\n\n    struct Layout {\n        uint256 tokenIds;\n    }\n\n    function layout() internal pure returns (Layout storage l) {\n        bytes32 slot = STORAGE_SLOT;\n        assembly {\n            l.slot := slot\n        }\n    }\n\n    function currentTokenId() internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return layout().tokenIds;\n    }\n\n    function incrementTokenId() internal {\n        layout().tokenIds += 1;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x4424f37e4c4fc7660d7123a9b3da6f640e87eeeee71076cfc95713cb7804e516","license":"GPL-2.0-or-later"}},"version":1}

params.account: address to query for approval granted
params.operator: address to query for approval received

returns._0: whether operator is approved to spend tokens held by account

params.index: position in global token list to query
position in owner's token list to query

PRBMathSD59x18__AbsInputTooSmall().notice: Emitted when the input is MIN_SD59x18.

PRBMathSD59x18__MulInputTooSmall().notice: Emitted when one of the inputs is MIN_SD59x18.

PRBMathSD59x18__MulOverflow(uint256).notice: Emitted when the intermediary absolute result overflows SD59x18.

PRBMathSD59x18__PowuOverflow(uint256).notice: Emitted when the intermediary absolute result overflows SD59x18.

PRBMath__MulDivFixedPointOverflow(uint25.notice: Emitted when the result overflows uint256.

PRBMath__MulDivOverflow(uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when the result overflows uint256.

approve(address,uint256).notice: grant approval to given account to spend token

balanceOf(address).notice: query the balance of given address

getApproved(uint256).notice: get approval status for given token

isApprovedForAll(address,address).notice: query approval status of given operator with respect to given address

ownerOf(uint256).notice: query the owner of given token

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: transfer token between given addresses, checking for ERC721Receiver implementation if applicable
transfer token between given addresses, checking for ERC721Receiver implementation if applicable

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).notice: grant approval to or revoke approval from given account to spend all tokens held by sender

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: query whether contract has registered support for given interface

tokenByIndex(uint256).notice: get token at given internal storage index

tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).notice: get token of given owner at given internal storage index

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: transfer token between given addresses, without checking for ERC721Receiver implementation if applicable
